name: muslin
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U or C ] UK a very thin cotton material, or a piece of this material: A 19th-century painting of a girl in a muslin dress hung on the wall. The soured milk is strained through muslin to leave a soft ball of cheese.
Elena Koroleva/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C ] UK a square of thin cotton material, used especially for wiping a baby's mouth: She has prepared by stocking up on nappies and muslins.
lostinbids/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ U ] US a plain cloth made from cotton that can be very light and thin or very heavy and thick: She sewed cheap muslin slipcovers for the couch.
Kameleon007/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesPass the stock through a muslin cloth and finish with the butter. Fashionable Indian muslins were smuggled in from the Channel Islands.She saw two packs of white towelling babygrows, nappies, wipes, a packet of dummies, and a pack of muslins.
